item.title: Marvel Rivals Reveals a New Type of Cosmetic
item.description:
Summary

  • Season 3 of Marvel Rivals will introduce a new type of cosmetic called accessories.
  • NetEase Games is eliminating daily missions with the launch of Season 3.
  • Players can earn the free Symbiote Storm skin by completing Milano Repair Logs missions during Season 3.

NetEase Games has revealed that Marvel Rivals will be launching a new type of cosmetic called accessories with the launch of Season 3 on July 11. In addition to releasing new cosmetics, Marvel Rivals will also be adding Phoenix to the popular hero shooter's ever-expanding roster with the debut of Season 3.

The upcoming season will introduce a wide variety of changes meant to improve the experience of players. It was recently revealed that Marvel Rivals will be removing daily missions, which will change the way Chrono Tokens are distributed throughout the course of a season. Instead, Season 3 seems to have a strong focus on weekly missions, which will continue to roll over if the player doesn't complete them during the week that they're introduced. Many fans seem to believe the change will eliminate some of the grind that was present in previous seasons. Moving forward, seasons will only last for two months, meaning gamers can expect to see fresh content even more frequently than before.

In a recent post on Twitter, NetEase Games revealed that a new type of cosmetic will be added to the game with the launch of Season 3 of Marvel Rivals . These cosmetics are called accessories and, from the footage shown, they appear to be character-specific. For instance, Spider-Man can be seen sporting the MJ Plush, which hangs from the back of his hip. This allows the player to see the accessory at all times without creating too much visual clutter. One of the accessories is even a plush of Deadpool, a character who is not currently available as a playable hero.

Marvel Rivals Is Introducing Free Accessories

According to the post, players will be able to acquire these cosmetics without using any of Marvel Rivals ' existing currencies. Instead, gamers will earn Accessory Points by playing the Quick Match and Competitive game modes. Players will then be able to trade these Accessory Points for hero-exclusive cosmetics.

Gamers looking to acquire even more free cosmetics may be excited to learn that NetEase Games is giving players a chance to earn a new skin for Storm in Marvel Rivals . The new costume is called Symbiote Storm, and it's modeled after the mutant's appearance in the Venomized Variant of the comic book X-Men Prime , which debuted in 2017. This skin can be earned by completing the Milano Repair Logs challenges, which will become available on July 11. With a whole new season to enjoy and even more content just around the corner, many fans are feeling optimistic about the future of Marvel Rivals .

item.title: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3+4: Canada Challenges and Collectibles
item.description:
There are plenty of levels throughout Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3+4, but not all of them are set in the states. Many countries, such as Rio are used for the game, and each level is packed with challenges and collectibles to knock off a checklist.

Players will unlock plenty of levels over the course of the game, with Canada being unlocked once players have completed a handful of challenges and collectibles from the Foundry level. Both Canada and Rio are levels featured in the Tony Hawks Pro Skater 3 portion of this remaster.

How to Get Sick Score for Canada in THPS 3+4

There are many different Skaters in the game, so be sure to try them all and find the one that feels right for you. Canada is the second level of the game, so players should not worry if they cannot get the scores they need just yet. Play more levels, practice, and once you are more confident in your skills, go to the skate park of this area. The skate park is filled with ramps, grind rails, and flat surfaces to perform manuals.

Canada is praised for being one of the highest rated levels in the game. Players will find there is a lot to do, and will have a blast doing it all.

How to Collect SKATE for Canada in THPS 3+4

At the start of the level, promptly turn left to face the other direction. You will see the S for Skate. While facing the S, you will see a log cabin with a ramp in front of it. Use this ramp to get to the top of this log cabin where the K will be. Follow the boardwalk leading away from the roof of this cabin. Do not take the turn, and instead go straight, where you can grind on a tree to get the A.

Once this tree branch grind rail ends, you will see another tree just like it that you can also grind. Grind this one as well to get the T. Go in a straight line after getting the T and you will hit a ramp with the E above it.

How to Get the Secret Tape for Canada in THPS 3+4

Players can use the ramp, which they get the E in SKATE from, to reach a higher area to the right of the ramp. They can then use this platform to reach an even higher area. On the opposite side of this platform will be a log chute.

They will need to first grind along the left side leading the ramp with the E to raise this platform higher.

Ride to the end of this log shoot and then grind the right side of the railway tracks. These tracks will pass under the Secret Tape of Canada . There are many challenges and collectibles in each level, so getting as many as you can in a single run helps make things go a lot faster.

How to Nosegrind Around the Horn for Canada in THPS 3+4

Go back to the same roof as before, and, like before, get onto the boardwalk. This time, take the left turn. You will see some orange traffic cones at the end of the boardwalk. You can grind some cables to the right of these cones.

Keep grinding these cables, and you will pass through a hole in a tree, transitioning into grinding the edge of the boardwalk. Once you complete this grind, you will have completed this challenge.

a great early stat to invest in is Rail Balance for challenges such as this.

How to Get Chuck Unstuck for Canada in THPS 3+4

Head straight from the starting location. You will see some people on the left on the other side of the fence. One of them is stuck to a pole, and the other two are laughing. Ram into the person stuck to the pole to get them unstuck.

How to Bury The Bully for Canada in THPS 3+4

Go straight once the level starts. After traveling for a bit, stop and turn around. Head back to where you started and ramp up onto the treetop boardwalks. Grind the snow-covered tree branches on the right side to cause the snow to fall down and bury the bully.

How to Impress the Five Skaters for Canada in THPS 3+4

Players will not need to impress a group but rather 5 individual skaters scattered around the area. Luckily, players do not need to chain together an elaborate combo between them. Perform any combo in front of each skater, and a prompt will appear on-screen saying how many have been completed.

All the skaters can be found in the skatepark near the start of the level. The first is wearing a red hoodie with a dark gray horned helmet. The second has a blue top, beanie, and face mask. The third has a black helmet and puffy orange jacket. The fourth has a red top and black beanie. The last skater is at the very back of the skate park and has a buffy purple jacket with a red shirt underneath.

If players are having trouble landing tricks, they should look into remapping their controls.

How to Get All Stat Points for Canada in THPS 3+4

There are three Stat Points for this level.

Stat Point 1

The first Stat Point can be seen on the right-hand side when players start the level. Head forward and then go right into the skate park. Jump into the skating bowl, turn around, and then use the ramp to grab it

Stat Point 2

The second Stat Point can be obtained by heading left at the ramp used to get up into the log cabin while doing the SKATE challenge.

Stat Point 3

Do a wide left turn after getting Stat Point 2 to find a dilapidated area with this Stat point. Players can also go to the Skate Park, stand on the Red Bull image, and look between two trees to see Stat Point floating in the air. Use the ramps to get it.

How to get All Money for Canada in THPS 3+4

There are 4 money icons in Canada. Players will already be familiar with well-designed areas of the map from the above sections. Here is a fast way to find each stack of money using those areas.

  • On the same railway as the Secret Tape, use the left rail instead.
  • Jump from the first bowl in the skate park to the middle bowl.
  • From the Red Bull image in the skate park, look at the two trees to see the money floating. Use the tilting tree to grind up to it.
  • Use the ramp at the very back of the skate park to reach the money at the top.

How to get the Logo Icon for Canada in THPS 3+4

From the third money location, ride the railway track back to the cabin to have enough momentum to grind the cable up to the telephone pole. The Iron Galaxy logo is a great touch-up to where the game is now compared to where it originated.

How to get the Hidden Deck for Canada in THPS 3+4

Head straight from the start of the level, and you will see a large Canadian flag with a ramp at the bottom. Use the middle of this ramp to get the Hidden Deck floating in front of this flag.

There are still many levels ahead of players after Canada, such as Skaters Island.

item.title: Final Fantasy 9s Hunting Festival is Fertile Ground for a Remake
item.description:
Final Fantasy 9 remains one of Square Enixs most beloved entries, thanks to its heartfelt tone, distinctive art style, and endearing characters. With this year marking its 25th anniversary, the game has returned to the spotlight. A commemorative website recently launched with updated character artwork from Toshiyuki Itahana, a collection of new merchandise, and a celebratory video, all reminding longtime players why the game has endured.

What fans didnt get, however, was confirmation of the long-rumored Final Fantasy 9 remake. Despite online speculation and rumors about development troubles, the project has not been publicly canceled. Some insiders suggest the game is still in production, though Square Enix has remained silent. If the remake does move forward, the developers have a chance to reimagine underused set pieces. One of the best candidates: The Hunting Festival in Lindblum.

Final Fantasy 9s Hunting Festival Needs More Options

The Lindblum Hunting Festival is a major early-game moment in Final Fantasy 9 , giving players a break from the main narrative to focus on a local tradition. Participants race to defeat monsters across the city to rack up points and win a prize. Although Zidane is the main playable character during the event, both Freya and Vivi participate in the festival as well. However, players dont get to directly control their actions or see their side of the event unless it intersects with Zidanes.

The one exception occurs if the player chooses not to interfere when Freya goes after the Zaghnol. If Zidane steps back, she defeats it alone and wins the festival. Its a neat twist, but it also underlines a missed opportunity. The remake could expand this event into a fully playable multi-character sequence. Players could choose which character to play as or even switch between Zidane, Freya, and Vivi.

Unlike other minigames in the Final Fantasy series, such as Blitzball or Triple Triad, the Hunting Festival is narrative-driven and quick to complete, which makes it easier to enhance without overstaying its welcome.

A future version could also give each character different objectives or monster types. Vivi, for example, might focus on controlling Black Mage-style magic from afar, avoiding larger beasts but gaining more points through clever use of spells. Freya, with her Dragoon abilities, could focus on verticality, hopping across buildings to chase down flying enemies.

Final Fantasy 9 Team Mechanics Could Deepen the Competition

Team-ups are extremely limited in the original event. Outside of the optional Freya-Zidane encounter against the Zaghnol, the event is a solo affair. A remake could rethink the rules and allow for spontaneous team-ups or rivalries. Characters could decide mid-event to work together temporarily, splitting points based on performance or even stealing the final blow from one another.

A modern version might feature dynamic in-game choices: Zidane could help Vivi out of a tough fight, or players could choose to sabotage Freya to ensure their victory. The stakes would be higher than just the prize from Regent Cid, a Final Fantasy staple character name. It could impact later story choices or interpersonal relationships. That kind of consequence would fit naturally with the games already strong character dynamics.

Even something as simple as contextual dialogue changes or affection-based systems could deepen the event. If Zidane teams up with Vivi and shows kindness, maybe Vivi speaks differently later. If Freya dominates the field and is given support, maybe her confidence is reflected more strongly in later cutscenes.

Fire Emblem: Three Houses used this type of branching relationship impact to enhance its academy festival scenes. A similar approach could benefit Final Fantasy 9 by enriching its world through character-driven decisions.

FF9's Hunting Festival Deserves a Modern Design Philosophy

While nostalgia makes the Hunting Festival memorable, its design is limited by the hardware and scope of its time. A Final Fantasy 9 remake (so long as its still in production) could keep the premise intact but bring it up to modern standards. With more complex AI, better tracking systems, and seamless map transitions, the city of Lindblum could become a reactive arena.

Players could find themselves hunting creatures across rooftops, into tunnels, or even protecting citizens while scoring bonus points. Timed challenges or evolving conditions (like a thunderstorm suddenly altering visibility or slowing movement) could change the strategy. This wouldnt just improve the festival as a minigame but make it feel more like a real event in a living city.

Thematically, giving more agency to Freya and Vivi also aligns with the games emotional beats. Vivi struggles with his identity and mortality, while Freya deals with heartbreak and lost honor. Letting them stand out in a public event would add small but meaningful moments to their arcs. Its not about giving them victories, but about giving them presence. Heres hoping that fans not only hear good news about the remake soon, but that such memorable events are recreated with care.

item.title: Analyst Attribute Steam's Success to Users Acting Like 'Drunken Sailors'
item.description:
A gaming marketing analyst looking into Steam 's success and how its users spend time and money on games has referred to the userbase as "a bunch of drunken sailors who spend money irresponsibly." The comparison may surprise or offend some Steam fans, but despite the harsh wording, the analyst has some data backing up his claims.

It's been an ongoing joke that gamers have more games in their libraries than they actually have time to play, yet they still keep spending money on new games. Exciting releases, word-of-mouth trends, discounts, and no need to keep physical copies can lead to a bit of hoarding for some fans. That tendency is what this analyst is taking a look at.

Games marketing analyst Chris Zukowski wrote an article detailing how a surprising portion of players don't actually play the game they own, referring to the users as "drunken sailors... who spend money irresponsibly." Zukowski compares players' unplayed libraries to other hobbies, stating that hobbyists don't care how much they spend on a subject they're interested in. He pointed to statistics from a year ago that indicate that on Steam, the average user has only played half of the games that they own. He indicates that Steam has "super gamers" who repeatedly spend money on games when they don't intend to actually play them.

Why Steam Gamers Keep Buying New Games

There are some additional reasons for this trend. For example, most Steam players have bought at least one game that's been on sale. The Steam Summer and Winter sales are a major occasion for PC gamers, with numerous titles seeing steep discounts over this period of time. This can lead to annual impulse buying for players, even if they're already preoccupied with something else and don't have time to play a new game.

One thing worth pointing out is that this information seems to correlate with a prior survey which found that most PC gamers are playing older games. That study looked at nearly 80,000 gamers and found that 67% of time spent on gaming was going to games six years old or older, with another 25% dedicated to games between two to five years old. It seems likely that many of these players are nonetheless buying new games, even if they're not actively playing them.

As gaming becomes more and more popular, excellent new games are landing all the time, whether from AAA studios or indie developers. On top of that, loved older games are being ported or remade, further adding to the pile of titles that players want to check out. At this point, there simply may not be enough hours left in the day for the average PC gamer to play everything that they want to. Whether spending money like a "drunken sailor" is simply a lack of time management or wishful thinking, it doesn't seem like the trend will change anytime soon.

item.title: Palia Gets Massive Update for July 2025
item.description:
Life sim Palia has received a major summer update called Solstice Bloom, which brings a whole bunch of stuff for players, including new features, quests, plushies, decor, and much more. Palia s Solstice Bloom update also introduces plenty of improvements and adjustments to several areas of the game, while also addressing a good number of bugs.

Palia is a cozy, free-to-play life simulation MMO that invites players into a peaceful experience focused on crafting, farming, fishing, and socializinglike an online Stardew Valley . Here, players engage in activities like gardening, cooking, insect catching, and home decoration, though Palia also has a social side: players can befriend or romance villagers, collaborate with others on shared tasks, and visit each others homes through Home Tours. Palia continues to expand through seasonal updates and major additions, such as The Elderwood expansion, which brought a new region, creatures, and storylines to the game. Now, developer Singularity 6 is releasing yet another update to keep bringing fresh content to players.

To celebrate the summer season, the Solstice Bloom update introduces six new quests aiming to explore deeper into Palia s NPCs' lives. Some of these quests include Platinum Wedding Bells, where players must help Hodari craft a special gift for his sisters wedding; Zed Drop, where they will help Zeki steal Eshes wax seal to forge documents for illegal medicine; and Food for Thought, where Reth and Jel need to cook soup to ease Jels stress before his moms fashion show, with players lending them a hand. These missions will unlock different rewards while also helping players gain new friendships.

In addition to the new quests in Palia , the River Shark and Elder Shark are joining the games plushie collection. Moreover, players will now be able to change their name or nickname by logging into accounts.palia.com, though the developer noted this can only be done every 30 days. Singularity 6 has also launched the Palia Vinyl, which contains the games original soundtrack, with also limited signed editions for collectors.

Additionally, Palia 's Elderwood Umbraan Decor furniture set is now available. To unlock these items, players must first buy the Outer Umbraan starter pack, which provides the initial recipes needed to begin crafting the full collection. On top of all this, the Solstice Bloom update makes some improvements and adjustments to decor stacking, storage, muskin, and growable flowers.

Singularity 6 also addressed a significant number of bugs affecting gameplay, housing & decor, accounts, character creation, collections, wardrobe, and more. As the developer continues working on the cozy sim, players have a lot to look forward to in Palia s Solstice Bloom update.

Palias Solstice Bloom Update Patch Notes

  • Help your Villager pals by completing five brand-new Discovery Quests!
  • Take a chunk out of your Plush wishlist when you collect some toothy new Plushes!
  • Celebrate the pinnacle of Elderwood elegance with Umbraan Decor!
  • Roll a crit with fashionable new outfit collections, Tool Skins, Gliders, Emotes, and more!
  • Ready for a rebrand? Players can now refresh their Full Name or Nickname!
  • Experience even more bug fixes and quality-of-life updates that help both new and veteran Palians!

Improvements & Adjustments

Decor Stacking

Decor items now stack up to 30 (or higher, if they already did) to help creative players spend less time running to storage and more time decorating!

Muskin Support for all Decor

Muskin (mushroom leather) can now be used for all recipes that require leather. More options, same great results!

Grow Stage UI

Growable flowers and decor now show an icon in their UI to indicate their current growth stage. Plants that are watered are considered a different stage, meaning theyll also be separated in inventory and storage.

Tints in Inventory and Storage

Decor that has a tint applied to it will now show which tint is applied on the icon itself within your inventory and storage. No more guessing which color coffee table youre about to place!

Honey Lure Changes

The honey lure has been rebalanced and normalized across multiple locations.

Top Bug Fixes

Gameplay

  • Addressed occasional crash issues with the modification bench.
  • Fixed an issue where Fishing XP was not properly balanced.
  • In the Cooking UI, recipe steps are no longer cut off.
  • Addressed an issue for some players where Subira did not appear in the Mansion during the "Extravagant Expectations" quest.
  • Fixed an issue that allowed players to escape the playable area at the Fallen Aqueduct in Elderwood.
  • Fixed an issue where the Sugar icon in the Petit Fives x3 recipe was cropped and missing a tooltip in the Cooking UI.
  • Fungopher holes are no longer floating in Prismbeard Cave.
  • Fixed an issue where the Courier Pet quest marker appeared on the map regardless of quest eligibility or progression.
  • Narrative items in the Prismbeard cave are now aligned with the terrain.
  • Quest marker added for the final step of the "Even More Treasure" quest.
  • In the Prismbeard Questline - Quest markers for Auni & Nai'o now reliably appear throughout the questline.
  • For PC & Switch: Addressed visual artifacts in vertical terrain throughout Elderwood.
  • Unintended consumables such as Lootbags no longer display the "Focus Increase" icon.
  • In the "Even More Treasure" quest, Hassain should now appear properly where he previously might not have.

Housing & Decor

  • Fixed an issue where the Palian Show Home could not be entered when first loading the Palian Show Home UI.
  • In Home Tours, players are now unable to contribute materials into buildings under construction.
  • Fixed an issue between decor stacking and tinted decor
  • The issue limiting players to 8 Storage Chests across all plots instead of 8 per plot has been fixed.

Social

  • Fixed an issue where PC/Steam users would receive infinite party invites when sent from players on PS5 or XBOX Series X/S.

Accounts, Character Creation, Collections, and Wardrobe

  • The Master Survivalist accomplishment can now be completed as it no longer includes incorrect items
  • Added padding in the Quest update notifications.

Controls & Accessibility

  • On Switch: fixed an issue where changing action bindings immediately after joining a server caused multiple problems.
  • On PC: Left click while highlighting a tool/emote now equips that tool and closes the tool/emote wheel.
  • On PS5: The Adaptive Trigger Intensity now changes to default when resetting to default

Premium Cosmetics

  • Fixed an issue where the voice options in Jel's mirror did not play back any sound.
  • The zoom function no longer breaks when inspecting Graphic Hoodies in the premium store.
  • Fixed an issue where the user was not able to move the highlight after performing a search.
  • Fixed an issue where players were not receiving their refer a friend rewards consistently.

Top Known Issues

New to 0.193

  • Ancient Koi and Sabertoothed Anchovey do not grant XP.
  • Maws Plush and Maws Fin Plush are displaying an incorrect name.
  • Slumber Fox Plush is displaying the incorrect name when inspecting the plush on the housing plot.
  • Catching a Common Grumpy Granite Rockhopper incorrectly triggers the "My First Rare Bug" achievement.
  • Some bodies of water are both fishable and traversable, which is unintended.
  • Deep water in the Elderwood Clearing Landscape may not trigger teleportation back to land as intended.
  • Deep water near the Statue Garden in Bahari Bay may not trigger teleportation back to land as intended.
  • Deep water in the Autumn Acres Landscape may not trigger teleportation back to land as intended.
  • Players may occasionally fall through the world when loading into Home Tours.
  • Some Accomplishments may not complete.
  • PC: Opening the social menu after receiving a party invite may trigger an unintended sound effect.
  • In the "Knowledge Sleuth" quest, Caleri may not appear in the restricted section of the library.
  • Some Console players may encounter a login error stating: "You cannot play Palia while having online communications disabled. Please enable them to continue."
  • On a controller, a cursor reset issue may occur when switching inventory rows.

Other Issues

  • Some Echo VFX does not appear.
  • Players may occasionally fall through the world when loading into Home Tours.
  • Color switching doesn't work on the Solstice Bloom Axe for the feminine character. This will be fixed for all players in the next available update.
  • Artifacts currently do not sort into their own category, they will appear in the All category.
  • If selected, the Enable Own Overhead Name button does not display the overhead name until the player switches servers.
  • Holding the Inspect Garden button while entering Placement Mode can cause the UI to stay stuck.
  • The Trading Tips quest dialogue may be confusing if it is obtained from the Elderwood trading post.
  • In some instances, friend requests may not appear immediately. Exiting the game and logging back in should resolve this issue.
  • Players playing on Xbox will sometimes encounter an issue where empty usernames are displayed when viewing the Friends List on the social panel.
  • Players logging into Palia for the first time may not be able to use community chat features. Fully exiting the game and restarting the application should resolve the issue.
  • Clicking View Store may cause a brief black screen and unresponsive controls before the Premium Store opens as expected.
  • Some users may get stuck in a cinematic soundstage after completing the Elderwood introduction cinematic.
  • Some Series 1 Sticker Set accomplishments might not progress when opening Sticker packs until after a server transition occurs or the player relogs.
  • In some instances, players can roll dice faster than text inputs can display.
  • The flipping mechanic in the cooking minigame could become stuck in a looped animation, preventing progression.
  • Some players are unable to send party invites or sync to the correct server, making multiplayer features inaccessible.
  • Some players could experience unintentional overlap between the emoji menu and emojis used in chat.
